version.description: A show curated by the artist Surekha

version.description: A show curated by the artist Surekha

version.name: Slain
version.description: Judah Sandhy on vocals, Bryden Lewis and Manek D’Silva on guitars, Jared Sandhy on drums, Jonathan Wesley on keys, and Naresh Nathan on bass are Slain, a melodic and progressive rock and metal outfit

version.name: Slain
version.description: Judah Sandhy on vocals, Bryden Lewis and Manek D’Silva on guitars, Jared Sandhy on drums, Jonathan Wesley on keys, and Naresh Nathan on bass are Slain, a melodic and progressive rock and metal outfit

version.description: Judah Sandhy on vocals, Bryden Lewis and Manek D’Silva on guitars, Jared Sandhy on drums, Jonathan Wesley on keys, and Naresh Nathan on bass are Slain, a melodic and progressive rock and metal outfit

version.name: Solo show
version.description: Paintings by Trupti Dave, an artist and architect based in Ahmedabad

version.name: Group show
version.description: Paintings by Atul Ojhal Dubey and Chitra from Bangalore, Bhanumati and Gokul Gowder from Ooty, and Shibu Sridhar from Kerala

version.name: Group show
version.description: Paintings by Kolkata-based artists Anjan Bhattacharya, Biswarup Haldar, Rajib Sur Roy, Subrato Ghosh and Utpal Ghosh

version.name: Solo show
version.description: Paintings by Trupti Dave, an artist and architect based in Ahmedabad

version.name: Group show
version.description: Paintings by Atul Ojhal Dubey and Chitra from Bangalore, Bhanumati and Gokul Gowder from Ooty, and Shibu Sridhar from Kerala

version.name: Group show
version.description: Paintings by Kolkata-based artists Anjan Bhattacharya, Biswarup Haldar, Rajib Sur Roy, Subrato Ghosh and Utpal Ghosh

version.name: Sangeetha, Anjana and Shubhashini
version.description: A selection of varnams – elaborate Carnatic compositions – composed by Muthaiah Bhagavathar and rendered by the vocalists

version.name: Padma Gurudutt
version.description: A lecture by the musician and musicologist

version.name: The Bangalore Brothers
version.description: MB Hariharan and S Ashok, will demonstrate an effective and rational approach to neraval – the extempore improvisation aspect of Carnatic music – at this concert, accompanied by BK Raghu on violin, and R Adamya on mridangam

version.name: S Shankar
version.description: A lecture by the Carnatic vocalist

version.name: G Ravikiran
version.description: The vocalist will talk on Sangita Sampradaya Pradarshini, a tome on Carnatic concepts

version.name: RK Padmanabha
version.description: A lecture by the vocalist

version.name: V Vamshidhar
version.description: A talk on Bhairavi, Mukhari, Huseini, Manji and other ragas by the flautist

version.name: RK Srikantan
version.description: A lecture by the vocalist

version.name: Srimatha, Apeksha and Shikha
version.description: The trio will present a concert on dying musical forms, like of the sooladis and mundige from Dasa Sahitya, or the Kannada literature of the bhakti movement

version.name: M Suryaprasad
version.description: A lecture by the dance and music critic

version.name: S Ashok and Ranjani Venkatesh
version.description: The mridangam artists will present LayaVinyasa, a performance in the Chandas tala

version.name: BK Chandramouli
version.description: A lecture by the mridangam artist

version.name: Ashwini Satish
version.description: An analysis of musical compositions by the vocalist

version.name: Sukanya Prabhakar
version.description: A lecture by the vocalist and musicologist

version.name: Vrinda Acharya
version.description: The vocalist will present a talk explaining aspects of laya, or rhythm, in raga alapana (melodic improvisation)

version.name: TS Sathyavathy
version.description: A lecture by the vocalist and musicologist

version.name: Kanchana Ranjani Sisters
version.description: Sriranjani and Sruthiranjani, will present a Carnatic recital of tiruppugal – devotional songs in Tamil – accompanied by Shankar Rajan on violin, and Anirudh Bhat on mridangam

version.name: RA Ramamani
version.description: A lecture by the vocalist

version.name: N Rajkamal
version.description: The flautist will present a talk on the elements of spontaneity and mathematics in swara kalpana (raga improvisation)

version.name: Mysore M Nagaraj
version.description: A lecture by the violinist

version.name: Ravichandra Kulur
version.description: A Carnatic concert, featuring the flautist, accompanied by HN Bhaskar on violin, Neyveli R Narayanan on mridangam, and SN Narayanamurthy on ghatam

version.name: Radhika Balakrishnan
version.description: A talk on aspects of varnams in both abhyasa gaana (music for education) and sabha gaana (music meant for concerts) by the vocalist

version.name: Kanaka Swamy
version.description: A lecture by the vocalist

version.name: NR Harini and NR Sharada
version.description: The vocalists will be accompanied by Venkatesh Joshier on violin, and Sudarshan Chakravarthy on mridangam

version.name: Vidyabhushan
version.description: A lecture by the vocalist

version.name: A Ashwin and G Ravikiran
version.description: A demonstration of pada – a kind of varnam – by the vocalists

version.name: RN Taranathan
version.description: A lecture by the vocalist

version.name: Shubha Santosh
version.description: The veena artist will present a demonstration of tana (a kind of varnam)

version.name: Suma Sudhindra
version.description: A lecture by the veena artist

version.name: S Ramani
version.description: The vocalist will present a demonstration of javalis (light compositions)

version.name: Mysore V Subramanya
version.description: A lecture by the music critic

version.name: Malavika Ramaswamy and Sharada Mohan
version.description: A concert of thillanas by composers from Mysore, rendered by the vocalists , accompanied by Phanindra Bhaskara on mridangam

version.name: RN Srilatha
version.description: A lecture by the vocalist

version.name: Manasi Prasad
version.description: A talk on the Hindu god Krishna, as seen by different Carnatic composers, presented by the vocalist

version.name: RN Thyagarajan
version.description: A lecture by the vocalist

version.name: BK Raghu
version.description: The violinist will present a demonstration of the violin as a solo and an accompanying instrument

version.name: D Balakrishna
version.description: A lecture by the veena artist

version.name: BS Arunkumar
version.description: A talk on the global status of south-Indian percussion instruments by the percussionist

version.name: TAS Mani
version.description: A lecture by the mridangam artist

version.name: Chandanabala Kalyan
version.description: The vocalist will demonstrate the effective rendition of ragam thanam pallavi – an improvisational form of singing – in a short duration, accompanied by BK Raghu on violin, and R Adamya on mridangam

version.name: MS Sheela
version.description: A lecture by the vocalist

version.name: TS Pattabhirama Pandit
version.description: A concert led by the vocalist, accompanied by Balu Raghuraman on violin, Srimushnam V Raja Rao on mridangam, and GS Ramanujan on ghatam

version.name: Bharatanatyam
version.description: The Sree Krishna Kalakshetra will present the sisters Veena Nair and Dhanya Nair performing the dance ballet Vaasudevamupasmahe, a Muthuswami Dikshitar composition. The performance will take place at Yuva Chetana and is organised jointly by the Suswaralaya College of Music and ISKCON

version.name: Bharatanatyam
version.description: The Sree Krishna Kalakshetra will present the sisters Veena Nair and Dhanya Nair performing the dance ballet Vaasudevamupasmahe, a Muthuswami Dikshitar composition. The performance will take place at Yuva Chetana and is organised jointly by the Suswaralaya College of Music and ISKCON

version.name: Bharatanatyam
version.description: Sangeeta K, a student at the Natya Institute of Kathak and Choreography, will perform items from a traditional margam – beginning with a pushpanjali, an invocatory piece, and ending with a thillana, a pure-dance sequence

version.name: Bharatanatyam
version.description: Apoorva C, a student of the bharatanatyam duo Kiran Subramanyam and Sandhya Kiran of the Rasika Academy of Performing Arts in Malleswaram, will showcase a traditional margam of bharatanatyam

version.name: Bharatanatyam
version.description: Sangeeta K, a student at the Natya Institute of Kathak and Choreography, will perform items from a traditional margam – beginning with a pushpanjali, an invocatory piece, and ending with a thillana, a pure-dance sequence

version.description: Apoorva C, a student of the bharatanatyam duo Kiran Subramanyam and Sandhya Kiran of the Rasika Academy of Performing Arts in Malleswaram, will showcase a traditional margam of bharatanatyam
